data.title: worth the visit
data.text: Has been here for a long time right by the square. Good food and good prices. Lower then most in the area.

data.title: Uptown yummies
data.text: This is a place dear to my heart. I could always count on the food to be good and fresh, This pace has been on this corner for yrs upon yrs. Must stop in for original Cashew chicken, Its the best.

data.title: Nice people, good food, excellent value!
data.text: I have been a customer for a number of years and keep going back.  The owners emigrated from Cambodia many years ago and are exceptional, hard working, friendly folks.  I generally get the special, which is Cashew Chicken, a real value.  Springfield is known for Cashew Chicken and theirs is the BEST.

data.title: Good food, good price!
data.text: Coming here for a local fav is always enjoyable. Servings are adequate, food always hot, service very friendly. Always leave happy!

data.title: good chinese food
data.text: enjoy good chinese food in family atmosphere  family owned & operated  been in business a long time ...

data.title: Very inexpensive good food!
data.text: Have been here many times for lunch and their specials are great!  Good selection of food choices in a quaint downtown setting.

data.title: Hole in the wall.
data.text: I was not impressed with the quality of the food or the speed of service.  There are many more opportunities to choose from downtown.

data.title: Old fashioned Springfield Style Cashew Chicken
data.text: The Rikshaw has been there forever, and in all my years visiting, the decor had not changed one bit. This, more or less, is what nearly every Chinese restaurant in Springfield used to look like- molded plastic booths, kitchy lanterns, flickering fluorescents, the ubiquitous Kikkoman bottles. As time has marched on, the Rikshaw was stayed true to itself, never even bothering to replace the missing portion of the rikshaw illustration on the front window. The staff is very friendly and has an amazing Cambodian survival story. If you're stuck downtown and need Cashew Chicken, the Rickshaw will hook you up. But if you have a car and another 30 minutes, hop on down to Canton Inn.

data.title: Generations of loyal customers
data.text: I have been going to the Riksha since moving to Springfield 18 years ago.  The food has been consistently good.  The staff is attentive and service is friendly and quick. Positioned just off the sqaure, with two free parking lots across the street makes the Riksha easily to access.  Generations of loyal customers mean they are doing it right.

data.title: It's a great place to experience  , I wish the parking was more convenient, I would be more of a regular customer !!
data.text: Small eat in area, but the food was great !! Good service and the restaurant was clean !! Kind of  "kitchy", but  nice !

data.title: Go eat at this great mom and pop place!
data.text: This is a great little hole-in-the-wall place with quality food!  I recommend the General Chicken and crab rangoons.

data.title: Good lunch spot on the square!
data.text: Very friendly folks and good food for lunch on the square! Reasonably priced and good flavors. Especially like their homemade egg drop soup! Yum!!

data.title: Not Exactly Elegant, but Does the Job!
data.text: Tired, worn, the very epitome of "hole-in-the-wall dive".  Tasty food.  Hot and sour soup does your body good on a chilly day.  Kung Pao chicken will make your stomach happy.  Inexpensive.

data.title: Best Chinese in Town
data.text: It may be a hole in the wall but these are always the best places. Been eating here for 15 years! If you're downtown you have to stop by.

data.title: Good food. Small place
data.text: Food was good the room was small room for 20 people the building could use some updates. Fair price on food, however there was only 2 people there (family owned?) Ohh and they only take cash no debit/credit. Would go back if i ever go back
